channel.title: FAQs – Regent College London
channel.description: HND Courses, Foundation Year, Top-Up and Bachelor Degrees

item.title: What is the difference between the BA and BSc Business Management course?
item.dc:creator: Rasika Umamahesh
item.description:
Award BA (Hons) Business Management BSc (Hons) Business Management Modules 4 Modules: • Strategic Marketing, • Leading and Managing Change, • Managing Innovation in Business • Corporate Strategy and Governance 5 Modules: • Two core modules – Dissertation • Strategic Management 3 options relating to pathways: People Management pathway modules: • BMP6003 Internal Human Resource … Continued

The post What is the difference between the BA and BSc Business Management course? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Award BA (Hons) Business Management BSc (Hons) Business Management
Modules 4 Modules:
• Strategic Marketing,
• Leading and Managing Change,
• Managing Innovation in Business
• Corporate Strategy and Governance		 5 Modules:

• Two core modules – Dissertation
• Strategic Management

3 options relating to pathways:

People Management pathway modules:
• BMP6003 Internal Human Resource Management
• BMP6004 Learning & Development
• BMP6005 Work and the Employment Relationship
Marketing pathway modules:
• BMP6006 E Commerce & Contemporary Marketing Practice
• BMP6007 Global Consumer Behaviour
• BMP6008 Integrated Digital Marketing Strategy
Awarding Body Buckinghamshire New University University of Bolton
Pathways • Business Management – General
Employability The programme is designed to consolidate the strategic thinking of students, so upon completion they are able to enter a career in general management (with skills applicable for all areas of business) and/or develop their own businesses. The principal aims to equip students with the knowledge, experience and skills to develop their employability / career and to pursue further study and professional development.
Timetable Two Evenings and Saturdays or two week days Usually Three Evenings or two week days

The post What is the difference between the BA and BSc Business Management course? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: When do my classes begin?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
You will receive your timetable on e-mail prior to the commencement of your course. If you have not received it contact the Registry team at your campus.

The post When do my classes begin? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
You will receive your timetable on e-mail prior to the commencement of your course. If you have not received it contact the Registry team at your campus.

item.title: What Mental Health Help do you offer?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
As above, we would also work with students on an individual case and put into place any support plans appropriate to aid your studies with us – these can take into account extensions to deadlines for modules as well as suitable flexibility around attendance on studies. This is subject to evidence and relevant documentation provided … Continued

The post What Mental Health Help do you offer? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
As above, we would also work with students on an individual case and put into place any support plans appropriate to aid your studies with us – these can take into account extensions to deadlines for modules as well as suitable flexibility around attendance on studies. This is subject to evidence and relevant documentation provided in confidence to the Student Support Team.

The post What Mental Health Help do you offer? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: I need help with my Mental Health. Who do I contact?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
Please call us on 020 3870 6666 and a member of the team will put you forward to our Student Support Team. One of the officers will be able to support you on your query and advise you appropriately in order for you to access the support you may need. Alternatively, you can call us … Continued

The post I need help with my Mental Health. Who do I contact? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Please call us on 020 3870 6666 and a member of the team will put you forward to our Student Support Team. One of the officers will be able to support you on your query and advise you appropriately in order for you to access the support you may need. Alternatively, you can call us and request to speak with Student Support reporting to us as a confidential matter as well as emailing us on Studentservices@rcl.ac.uk

You are also able to access Mental Health support through MIND Connect, our mobile phone app for all students to access anytime – 24 hours a day, on the app you will be able to find useful links as well as helpful tips relating to stress management and mental health support.

The post I need help with my Mental Health. Who do I contact? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: How do I report an absence from class?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
We ask all students to report absences with as much notice as possible in advance of the session you will be missing by completing and submitting an absence form to Studentservices@rcl.ac.uk. If you need further support or need to discuss matters further you can also call Student Services on 020 3870 6666 and a member … Continued

The post How do I report an absence from class? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
We ask all students to report absences with as much notice as possible in advance of the session you will be missing by completing and submitting an absence form to Studentservices@rcl.ac.uk. If you need further support or need to discuss matters further you can also call Student Services on 020 3870 6666 and a member of the team will be happy to assist you further. If you are unable to submit the absence form in advance of your absence then please complete and submit this for the duration you were away as soon as you return to studies, its also important you notify the college in your absence by emailing us and letting us know you will complete the absence form on your return so we are aware of any situations you may be facing.

The post How do I report an absence from class? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: How do I file a complaint?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
To start the complaint process, it’s always best to raise this with a college representative, they would normally put you in contact with a Student Services Officer who will closely manage your case and aim to resolve this for you as an informal process, if at the time you are not happy with the options … Continued

The post How do I file a complaint? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
To start the complaint process, it’s always best to raise this with a college representative, they would normally put you in contact with a Student Services Officer who will closely manage your case and aim to resolve this for you as an informal process, if at the time you are not happy with the options provided to you, the Student Services Officer will be able to walk you through the complaints procedure and policy for Regent College London where you can exhaust the matter further.

The post How do I file a complaint? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Do you help in finding jobs?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
Our team of Student Service Officers within the Student Services are at hand to support all our students on finding employment, they can work with you in identifying training requirements for roles and how best to support you in achieving your long-term goals. Student Service Officers are able to advise and guide you on the … Continued

The post Do you help in finding jobs? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Our team of Student Service Officers within the Student Services are at hand to support all our students on finding employment, they can work with you in identifying training requirements for roles and how best to support you in achieving your long-term goals. Student Service Officers are able to advise and guide you on the career routes you can potentially take. They are also able to help source useful external organisations in your job search.

The post Do you help in finding jobs? appeared first on Regent College London.

item.title: Who do I contact if I need help?
item.dc:creator: prodregent
item.description:
Mainline: 020 3870 6666 Email: Studentservices@rcl.ac.uk Drop us a Microsoft Teams Chat by mentioning us in your chat @Studentservices We are also looking to engage our students with other social media platforms such as WhatsApp and Facebook integration. We will keep this updated. Our team of trained front line administrators will assist you with your … Continued

The post Who do I contact if I need help? appeared first on Regent College London.
item.content:encoded:
Mainline: 020 3870 6666
Email: Studentservices@rcl.ac.uk

Drop us a Microsoft Teams Chat by mentioning us in your chat @Studentservices

We are also looking to engage our students with other social media platforms such as WhatsApp and Facebook integration. We will keep this updated.

Our team of trained front line administrators will assist you with your enquiry and help resolve the matter by reducing the number of people you need to speak with, they will aim to get you as much information alternatively, they may transfer you to the respective  department for your questions to be answered appropriately.

The post Who do I contact if I need help? appeared first on Regent College London.
